titleStmt.title: O. D. McManama et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Hardin Grant Cir. Ct
To His Excellency Thos E Bramlett
Govenor of Kentucky

Your Petitioner would respectfully represent and State that W. N. Simpson was tried and found guilty and fined seventy Dollars for an assault and battery upon the person of R. G. Merks ^at the present Term of this Court (Oct 1865)^ We further represent that we are well Known to W N Simpson that he his is generally Known in the community wherein he lives as a peacible quiet orderly citizen that the guilt and fine were both fixed upon Simpson alone by the Testimoney of sd Merks
We think this a case peculiarly addressed to thyour Executive Clemency and would pleased to have yours for Mr Simpson on the premises.

O. D. McManama
J M Collins
W T Simmons
N. H. Jeffers c, G, c, c,
Kemp S Carter Dpy clk.
James J Ross
J. W. Hutchison
John Carnes
P F McIlvain
W, Harrison
John Shively
M Burnett
Thomas E Williams
Wm R. Ransom
G. B, Dance
Patrick Burns
H S Rankin
J. F. Sheriff
J. Holbrook
B. Wilson, J, G, C
James F Ponder
A M Childers
J Peck
G W Simpson
W C Williams
T. P Evans
Peter S Edwards
Preston Isaacks
Thos D. Finnell
Wm McPherson
Albert Ackerman

J T odor

H H Sully

J, O'Hara Jr Atto
G. W. Craddock
Thos A Franklin Clk. G. C. C.

Grant Cir Ct
vs
W. N. Simpson
$70,
Assault & Battery
Remitted 11 Dec/65
